The alleged offences are said to have taken place between 2021 and 2022, during his time as a first-team regular at Arsenal.

Partey, who is currently on bail, is set to face trial on November 2.
He now plays for Spanish side Villarreal, with bail conditions allowing him to continue his football career, provided he informs police of any international travel at least 24 hours in advance and avoids contact with the complainants.
Despite the ongoing case, Partey remains a key figure in the Ghana national team, who are scheduled to face England in the World Cup group stage in the United States on June 23.
